content: Combat sport events in 2022 ***ONE 159: de Ridder vs. Bigdash*** was a [Combat sport](/wiki/Combat_sport) event produced by [ONE Championship](/wiki/ONE_Championship) that took place on July 22, 2022, at the [Singapore Indoor Stadium](/wiki/Singapore_Indoor_Stadium) in [Kallang](/wiki/Kallang), Singapore. ## Background A [ONE Middleweight World Championship](/wiki/ONE_Championship#Current_champions) bout between the champion [Reinier de Ridder](/wiki/Reinier_de_Ridder) and former champion [Vitaly Bigdash](/wiki/Vitaly_Bigdash) headlined the event. An interim [ONE Women's Atomweight Muay Thai World Championship](/wiki/ONE_Championship#Women's_Atomweight_World_Championship_3) bout between the [ONE Kickboxing Atomweight World champion](/wiki/List_of_ONE_Championship_champions#Women's_Atomweight_World_Championship_2) [Janet Todd](/wiki/Janet_Todd_(kickboxer)) and [Lara Fernandez](/wiki/Lara_Fernandez) was booked as the co-main event. **Fight card update** A Lightweight Muay Thai bout between [Sinsamut Klinmee](/wiki/Sinsamut_Klinmee) and former [ONE Lightweight Kickboxing Championship](/wiki/List_of_ONE_Championship_champions#Lightweight_World_Championship_3) challenger [Islam Murtazaev](/wiki/Islam_Murtazaev) was expected to take place at the event. However, Murtazaev withdraw due to a family emergency and was replaced by [Liam Nolan](/wiki/Liam_Nolan_(Muay_Thai)). A Women's Atomweight Submission grappling rematch between [2018 Asian Games gold medalist in Jujitsu](/wiki/Ju-jitsu_at_the_2018_Asian_Games) and [2019 Southeast Asian Games gold medalist in Jujitsu](/wiki/Jujitsu_at_the_2019_Southeast_Asian_Games) [Jessa Khan](/wiki/Jessa_Khan) and Amanda Alequin was scheduled to take place at the event. However, Alequin withdraw due to undisclosed medical issue. A Heavyweight bout between [Anderson Silva](/wiki/Anderson_Silva_(kickboxer)) and Mikhail Jamal Abdul-Latif was scheduled to take place at the event.
